BiblioData.Title: ACTIVE DAMPING OF HIGH SPEED SCANNING PROBE MICROSCOPE COMPONENTS
BiblioData.Abstract: A technique for actively damping internal vibrations in a scanning probe microscope is disclosed. The excitation of various mechanical movements, including resonances, in the mechanical assembly of an SPM can adversely effect its performance, especially for high speed applications. An actuator is used to compensate for the movements. The actuator may operate in only the z direction, or may operate in other directions. The actuator (s) may be located at positions of antinodes.

Claims.P: WHAT IS CLAIMED IS

1. A method, comprising: measuring forces on a support in a sensing system that relies on pressing against a sample that is supported by the support; and using an actuator to compensate said motion to thereby damp said motion.
2. A method as in claim 1, wherein said sensing system includes components of an atomic force microscope.
3. A method as in claim 1, wherein said sensing system includes a measuring cantilever.
4. A method as in claim 1, further comprising using a controller to determine a compensation based on said measuring, and to use said compensation to produce an output to said actuator.
5. A method as in claim 1, wherein said measuring and said using are carried out with separate structures.

6. A method as in claim 1, wherein said measuring and said using are carried out with a single structure that produces an output signal based on motion thereof, and which can move based on an applied signal.
7. A method as in claim 1, wherein said measuring comprises determining positions of specified movements by said support, and compensating movements at said positions of said positions .
8. A method as in claim 7, wherein said positions of specified movements are anti-nodes.

9. A method as in claim 1 wherein said using an actuator comprises using a first actuator oriented in a first direction relative to a direction of motion, and using a second actuator oriented orthogonal to said first actuator.

12. A method as in claim 2, wherein said measuring comprises measuring in a scanning tip atomic force microscope.
13. A method as in claim 1, further comprising further compensating said actuator using a weight.
14. A method as in claim 1, wherein said controller operates to determine no motion, and to take no action when no motion is detected.
15. A method as in claim 1, wherein said forces are one of movement, position, velocity and/or acceleration.
